articles.headline: Toys ‘R’ Us Tries to Rise From the Ashes. Wary Partners Try Not to Get Burned.
articles.snippet: The company’s liquidation last year left many people in the toy industry bitter. Now, an attempted comeback is being met with skepticism.
articles.abstract: The company’s liquidation last year left many people in the toy industry bitter. Now, an attempted comeback is being met with skepticism.
articles.lead_paragraph: In Fort Collins, Colo., a vacant Toys “R” Us store is being turned into an adventure park, with trampolines and dodge ball courts. Scandinavian furniture has replaced Fisher-Price baby gear at a location in Sioux Falls, S.D. In northwest Atlanta, a Hobby Lobby is moving in.

articles.headline: Aurora Shooting Updates: 5 Killed and Several Others Wounded
articles.snippet: A gunman opened fire inside a workplace in Aurora, Ill. Five people were killed, and others, including five police officers, were injured in the shooting. The gunman also died.
articles.abstract: A gunman opened fire inside a workplace in Aurora, Ill. Five people were killed, and others, including five police officers, were injured in the shooting. The gunman also died.
articles.lead_paragraph: AURORA, Ill. — A former warehouse employee who had recently lost his job stormed through his old workplace in suburban Chicago on Friday, killing five workers and injuring five police officers.
articles.byline: By Julie Bosman and Mitch Smith

articles.headline: Presidents Have Declared Dozens of Emergencies, but None Like Trump’s
articles.snippet: In invoking emergency powers for an end run around Congress in building his border wall, President Trump violated a norm of presidential self-restraint.
articles.abstract: In invoking emergency powers for an end run around Congress in building his border wall, President Trump violated a norm of presidential self-restraint.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump on Friday pointed to nearly five dozen previous instances in which presidents of both parties have declared emergencies as justification for his invocation of extraordinary powers to build his border wall. But there is no precedent for what he has just done.

articles.headline: Pope Defrocks Theodore McCarrick, Ex-Cardinal Accused of Sexual Abuse
articles.snippet: The move by Pope Francis, announced by the Holy See on Saturday, was the first time a cardinal in the United States has been removed from the priesthood.
articles.abstract: The move by Pope Francis, announced by the Holy See on Saturday, was the first time a cardinal in the United States has been removed from the priesthood.
articles.lead_paragraph: Pope Francis has expelled Theodore E. McCarrick, a former cardinal and archbishop of Washington, from the priesthood, after the church found him guilty of sexually abusing minors and adult seminarians over decades, the Vatican said on Saturday.
articles.byline: By Elizabeth Dias and Jason Horowitz

articles.headline: Isolated and Adrift, an American Woman Turned Toward Iran
articles.snippet: Monica Witt’s defection to Iran appears to have been part of a radicalization that began in military service and accelerated in graduate school.
articles.abstract: Monica Witt’s defection to Iran appears to have been part of a radicalization that began in military service and accelerated in graduate school.
articles.lead_paragraph: Monica E. Witt, a former United States Air Force intelligence specialist, made her way through the gleaming doors and majestic lobby of one of Tehran’s largest luxury hotels in 2013, on her way to a conference that was all about bashing American culture.
articles.byline: By Alan Blinder, Julie Turkewitz and Adam Goldman

articles.headline: Trump’s Attempt to Circumvent Congress Leaves Uneasy Senate Republicans With Hard Choice
articles.snippet: It remains to be seen whether Senate Republicans will act collectively to try to stop the president or how far into uncharted territory they are willing to follow him.
articles.abstract: It remains to be seen whether Senate Republicans will act collectively to try to stop the president or how far into uncharted territory they are willing to follow him.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Senator Shelley Moore Capito, Republican of West Virginia, spent the last two weeks hammering out a deal on federal spending and border security with colleagues from both parties, reassured by a sense that Congress was finally asserting itself as a civil, stabilizing force.
articles.byline: By Carl Hulse and Glenn Thrush

articles.headline: In Amazon Fight, Progressives Showed What They Want: A New Economic Agenda
articles.snippet: The clash has consequences beyond New York, going to the heart of a national debate likely to dominate the 2020 election: What is the best way to spread prosperity?
articles.abstract: The clash has consequences beyond New York, going to the heart of a national debate likely to dominate the 2020 election: What is the best way to spread prosperity?
articles.lead_paragraph: The political opposition that prompted Amazon to walk away from building a corporate headquarters in New York City featured a touchstone of the progressives’ economic agenda: ending tax policies that unfairly reward and pamper the wealthy.

articles.headline: With Trump’s Tough Deterrents, Many Asylum Seekers on the Border are Giving Up
articles.snippet: Thousands of migrants waiting to cross into the United States are returning home or staying in Mexico, dealing the president an apparent win.
articles.abstract: Thousands of migrants waiting to cross into the United States are returning home or staying in Mexico, dealing the president an apparent win.
articles.lead_paragraph: TIJUANA, Mexico — Pushed beyond their limits by prolonged waits in dangerous and squalid conditions in parts of Northern Mexico, thousands of caravan members who had been waiting to seek asylum in the United States appear to have given up, Mexican officials said, dealing President Trump an apparent win after a humbling week for his immigration agenda.
articles.byline: By Jose A. Del Real, Caitlin Dickerson and Miriam Jordan

articles.headline: Land Mines Block Saudi-Led Assault in Yemen, Killing Civilians
articles.snippet: Hundreds of thousands of land mines have stymied the Saudi-led forces in Yemen, and could pose a danger to civilians for decades to come.
articles.abstract: Hundreds of thousands of land mines have stymied the Saudi-led forces in Yemen, and could pose a danger to civilians for decades to come.
articles.lead_paragraph: NEHIM, Yemen — Desperate to break through enemy lines, the Saudi-backed forces fighting in Yemen are sending untrained soldiers to clear minefields, sometimes using only their bayonets.

articles.headline: ‘It Is Not a Closet. It Is a Cage.’ Gay Catholic Priests Speak Out
articles.snippet: The crisis over sexuality in the Catholic Church goes beyond abuse. It goes to the heart of the priesthood, into a closet that is trapping thousands of men.
articles.abstract: The crisis over sexuality in the Catholic Church goes beyond abuse. It goes to the heart of the priesthood, into a closet that is trapping thousands of men.
articles.lead_paragraph: MILWAUKEE — Gregory Greiten was 17 years old when the priests organized the game. It was 1982 and he was on a retreat with his classmates from St. Lawrence, a Roman Catholic seminary for teenage boys training to become priests. Leaders asked each boy to rank which he would rather be: burned over 90 percent of his body, paraplegic or gay.
articles.byline: By Elizabeth Dias and Gabriella Demczuk

articles.headline: Rift Between Trump and Europe Is Now Open and Angry
articles.snippet: Europeans pushed back against the Trump administration’s unilateralism at the Munich Security Conference, signaling a shift that is likely to be exploited by Russia and China.
articles.abstract: Europeans pushed back against the Trump administration’s unilateralism at the Munich Security Conference, signaling a shift that is likely to be exploited by Russia and China.
articles.lead_paragraph: MUNICH — European leaders have long been alarmed that President Trump’s words and Twitter messages could undo a trans-Atlantic alliance that had grown stronger over seven decades. They had clung to the hope that those ties would bear up under the strain.
articles.byline: By Steven Erlanger and Katrin Bennhold

articles.headline: The English Voice of ISIS Comes Out of the Shadows
articles.snippet: For years, an anonymous narrator extolled the Islamic State’s brutality in videos seen around the world. “I don’t regret it,” a Canadian captured in Syria says.
articles.abstract: For years, an anonymous narrator extolled the Islamic State’s brutality in videos seen around the world. “I don’t regret it,” a Canadian captured in Syria says.
articles.lead_paragraph: HASAKA, Syria — More than four years ago, the Federal Bureau of Investigation appealed to the public to help identify the narrator in one of the Islamic State’s best-known videos, showing captured Syrian soldiers digging their own graves and then being shot in the head.

articles.headline: For Wall Street Banks in London, It’s Moving Time
articles.snippet: One thing is clear about the legacy of Brexit: Financial services will be spread across Europe, with no one city again dominating the financial arena as London has.
articles.abstract: One thing is clear about the legacy of Brexit: Financial services will be spread across Europe, with no one city again dominating the financial arena as London has.
articles.lead_paragraph: In Paris, an empty Art Deco postal office is on its way to becoming Bank of America’s headquarters for its European brokerage arm. Where telegraph operators once tapped out messages, hundreds of traders and sales people will be working by spring.
articles.byline: By Amie Tsang and Matthew Goldstein

articles.headline: Bernie Sanders Stumbled With Black Voters in 2016. Can He Do Better in 2020?
articles.snippet: Mr. Sanders had a weak showing with black voters in his race against Hillary Clinton. A frayed relationship with his own outreach group was part of the problem.
articles.abstract: Mr. Sanders had a weak showing with black voters in his race against Hillary Clinton. A frayed relationship with his own outreach group was part of the problem.
articles.lead_paragraph: Shortly after Senator Bernie Sanders suffered a crushing loss in South Carolina’s Democratic primary in 2016, his campaign’s African-American outreach team sent a memo to top campaign leaders with an urgent warning.

articles.headline: In Bid to Conquer Oscars, Netflix Mobilizes Savvy Campaigner and Huge Budget
articles.snippet: Lisa Taback, who worked with Harvey Weinstein on awards campaigns for best picture winners like “The Artist” and “The King’s Speech,” is in charge of the lavish effort behind “Roma.”
articles.abstract: Lisa Taback, who worked with Harvey Weinstein on awards campaigns for best picture winners like “The Artist” and “The King’s Speech,” is in charge of the lavish effort behind “Roma.”
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — Netflix called it “‘Roma’ Experience Day.”

articles.headline: Chinese and Iranian Hackers Renew Their Attacks on U.S. Companies
articles.snippet: President Trump’s withdrawal from the Iran nuclear deal and his trade conflicts with China are believed to have inspired new waves of attacks.
articles.abstract: President Trump’s withdrawal from the Iran nuclear deal and his trade conflicts with China are believed to have inspired new waves of attacks.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Businesses and government agencies in the United States have been targeted in aggressive attacks by Iranian and Chinese hackers who security experts believe have been energized by President Trump’s withdrawal from the Iran nuclear deal last year and his trade conflicts with China.

articles.headline: Obama Quietly Gives Advice to 2020 Democrats, but No Endorsement
articles.snippet: Former President Barack Obama has been counseling Democratic candidates on how to win the White House in 2020. But he has no plans to pick a favorite.
articles.abstract: Former President Barack Obama has been counseling Democratic candidates on how to win the White House in 2020. But he has no plans to pick a favorite.
articles.lead_paragraph: A secret meeting of former President Barack Obama’s financial backers convened in Washington early this month: Organized by David Jacobson and John Phillips, Mr. Obama’s former ambassadors to Canada and Italy, the group interviewed an array of 2020 presidential candidates and debated whether to throw their wealth behind one or two of them.
